Honest, Outgoing, Knowledgeable Tour Guide In A Foreign Place. Now aren't these the words that you are looking for as a visitor looking for a tour guide and driver in a foreign country you've never been to? My husband and I went to Bali mid to end of May 2015 for our belated honeymoon from Southern California.Trip Advisor has drivers a plenty and good reviews galore but Bali Ari Tours is the best selection we could have made! The two days we scheduled tours with Wayan were nothing short of fantastic on all fronts-- service, value, quality, enjoyment. We liked him so much that we even asked him to drive us one last time to the airport at the end of our trip!We reached out to Wayan via Trip Advisor before our trip and sent him a short blurb about what activities and sites we were interested in and the 2 dates we wanted to do these activities. Being a type A personality, it was important that I do and see exactly what I wanted in the order I felt was logical for each day. Wayan was extremely accommodating, not to mention his prices were ridiculously good (8-10 hours of services is $50 USD and anything beyond that at $5/hr additional rate)!I've got only positive things to say about Wayan and his company but to break it down here are some of the reasons why I'd recommend any foreigner visiting Bali to pick his company:- Wayan is fluent in English. He is so fluent he will even crack jokes with you and even engage in some playful banter. When you're spending the entire day with a random stranger driving all over the island, this is a definite plus! What's surprising is that he is self taught fluent English speaker-- incredible!- Wayan is very thorough about following up to solidify daily schedules, including meeting time and location, and giving any miscellaneous information like projected entrance fee costs prior to the scheduled tour day. AND he is PROMPT--shows up either on time or a little earlier and that's super important when you don't have data service on your phone and your previously planned meeting place and time are all you've got to go on!-Wayan is charismatic and cheerful regardless of how tired he may be from the long day you've endured and will to the end accommodate your wants and needs. He is fun to be around and hanging out with him all day isn't awkward because he makes it a point to be your friend. - He is very easy-going, good-natured, and generously hospitable to all. We booked 2 different days with him and on each day we brought unexpected guests, fellow travelers we met along the way during our trip, and he was just as hospitable and accommodating to them as well!- He doesn't drive like a crazy maniac like the rest of Bali drivers. I get extremely carsick and his driving didn't make me sick. There are some bumpy, pot-hole ridden roads on the way to some of the places but he was very attentive about providing us with the smoothest ride possible. He also doesn't drive like many of the crazy drivers in Bali who swerve from their lane to the oncoming traffic lane!- He is physically fit and can lead you on any lengthy hike, regardless of difficulty. He is not one to just take you to a viewing point for a waterfall because it's too hard for him to lead the way directly to the bast of the fall! Wayan knows all the good hikes because he does a bunch of them with many of his clients and he'll even make sure you're fed along the way (we picked up some delicious copper bananas, mangosteens, and passion fruit to snack on! He'll make sure you get the local's price too!) - Lastly, he is HONEST. He will not try and pull a fast one over you or take you on some long winded tour just to get more money out of you. On our second day we ended up going 12+ hours and he still asked us for only $50. Of course we gave him more just because of his honesty and generosity!My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our tours with Wayan. He was an outstanding tour guide and driver and I would recommend him (and actually already have to 2 other groups I've learned are planning a trip to Bali) to any of my friends! Even the friends who joined us on our tours unplanned are recommending him to their friends and coworkers.

He did not show up. Dewa arrived on time to our hotel and guided us on a lovely day in and around Ubud. He was knowledgable about everything from Balinese temples to the best art galleries and cheapest wood carving shops. He helped us create an itinerary that was perfect for our needs. When we got hungry he asked about our food preferences and having learned we had not yet tasted Indonesian duck, he took us to an outstanding restaurant where we had the best duck I have ever eaten. Not to mention the view from our private gazebo was amazing (another tip from Dewa). During our drive Dewa answered all of our questions about Balinese culture and conversed with us about many topics. He entertained us with Balinese folklore after we purchased a wood carving with the Indonesian versions of Romeo and Juliet. He was kind and patient--we never felt rushed. He was also a very safe driver and watched over our belongings. I would recommend him to anyone wanting to take a tour of Bali. What a great day!

Good tour . We had the pleasure of having dewa himself for the tour. We made our own tour but upon meeting him he suggested alittle further out since we didn't want to be slammed with other tourist . It was about a 2 hour drive there . We saw the largest rice paddies in Bali, a temple , a small water fall and a lake. I am not a fan of long car rides so if you don't like long windy roads then suggest to stay closer to ubud! But over all it was a good trip and we got some good photos ! And he talks a lot so you can be informed of everything

Excellent. We booked a day with Dewa after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. He included everything that we wanted to see, speaks very good English, takes excellent photos and makes sure you have a great day. cant recommend him enough.
Best in Ubud. Safe driver, confortable car, good english speaker, really profesional and calm.Highly recommended, one of the best in Ubud!

Fantastic Dewa. We did 2 days private tour near Ubud with Dewa. He was very kindly and smiling, he speaks very good english and told us a lot of interesting info abuot the places and Balinese culture! Amazing experience, really racommanded!!

Excellent day tour!. We booked a day trip with dewa in advance for our stay in ubud. Dewa is a safe and reliable driver. We visited all the places we wanted to and had a great day. Dewa is extremely knowledgable and a friendly person and a great photographer! Would highly recommend for a day trip to show you some siteS in Bali.

Nyoman is an Excellent Tour Guide!. I originally contacted Dewa to drive us around central Bali for two days. Eventually I realized that I was in need of transportation from West Bali (Menjangan) to Ubud and I asked if he was available the day before the two days I had already hired him for. Dewa indicated that he was not available, but that Nyoman would be free to drive us to Ubud. At first I was a bit skeptical. I had read all of these great reviews about Dewa but I had not seen anything from Nyoman. Dewa insisted that Nyoman was a good driver and capable of handling our needs, so we moved forward.Nyoman picked us up from the Menjangan on time. The car was clean and in great shape. He was incredibly polite, and on the drive to Ubud we stopped at four or five different places to take in the local sites and cuisine. At the end of the first day Nyoman asked if we were comfortable using him for the following two days, or if we wanted Dewa to pick us up. We were comfortable with Nyoman so we asked him to drive us the next day.In the end we hired Nyoman for four straight days. He brought us all over the island. We saw over a dozen temples, went to shows, went shopping, and did a variety of other activities.I noticed many drivers waiting in the car while the people who hired them made their way through various attractions, not Nyoman. Nyoman personally walked us around everything and thoroughly explained what we were seeing, and where we should go. While we had a few ideas about what we wanted to see, Nyoman made many suggestions that really made our trip excellent. Nyoman was much more than a driver, he was a tour guide. His English was excellent, and his knowledge was superb. He is an all-around great guy who was quick to answer the hundreds of questions I asked him.Nyoman was even nice enough to accompany us through the pouring rain at times. He was always: on time, polite, eager to please, and quick to answer questions. If you are looking for a driver, hire anyone. If you are looking for a true, top of the line tour guide, hire Nyoman. I can’t say enough about how knowledgeable he is, and how great of a guy he truly is.

A private tour is the only way to see Ubud. Nyoman is the man. July 2016. My wife and I spent two days touring with Nyoman in and around Ubud. Most importantly, he is a skilled and safe driver. To a westerner, the roads in Bali are frighteningly narrow, serpentine, and congested. A knowledgeable and skilled driver is imperative. Don't try to do it yourself. Second, Nyoman is a reliable, knowledgeable, and experienced guide who knows how to efficiently show you all Bali has to offer. He was accommodating to our interests and dislikes. His patience and energy far exceeded ours, working beyond the 5:00 schedule both nights. He really added a great deal of value to our trip.

Safe Tours. My family and I visited Bali 14th 22nd July 2016.I commissioned Dewa online after reading his reviews.They turned out to very accurate.Dewa came on time to our agreed meeting place and began a very cordial relationship.He is very knowledgeable an very helpful, not becoming upset for any reason.His assistance helped to make our stay in Bali an enjoyable one.I would unnresrvedly recommend Dewa to anyone visiting Bali

Customized tour. I had a wonderful tour with Dewa. He was very patient as I changed my itinerary a few times before the date of my tour and was able to find the most efficient route to fit it all in. One bonus was even getting to go shopping at a local store far from the tourism and buy some of the Balinese skirts I admired so much.I appreciated his flexibility and he was a very safe, courteous driver.I would use him again.

Pleasurable day. Really pleasurable experience. The driver was more than accommodating with the fact that we have two young kids and the need to change the plan on the spur. He seemed very knowledgeable about the full set of sites and sounds in the area.

Brilliant - our second time with Dewa. Dewa helped us in 2014, and was so good then that we asked him to help us again this time. We were not disappointed. He continues to be absolutely superb. Friendly, helpful, knowledgeable, with brilliant English and very safe driving. Everything you could hope for, and more.

Spectacular Service. Dewa may be the best driver/guide I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. Before arriving in Bali I arranged for Dewa to take my wife and I and two other couples we were traveling with on an all day tour. Dewa arrived on time and prepared to take on the tour we had arranged via email. Our group decided we were not interested in the complete itinerary we had planned prior to our arrival. Dewa was very flexible, making changes as we requested and ensuring we saw and went to the best there was to offer for whatever our interests, including a very nice silver store, an elephant park, art galleries and wood carvers. Dewa was so great that although our hotel had transportation available to take us to Ubud and other local areas we instead called Dewa any time we knew that we wanted more than a simple drop off. Dewa even arranged for multiple vehicles to transport our group of 6 from Ubud to Seminyak for the second portion of our stay in Bali painlessly. After our arrival in Seminyak we quickly became dissatisfied with the transportation/service provided by our hotel, so I called Dewa. Dewa proceeded to drive over an hour from Ubud to take my wife and I on a final day of touring and to the airport for our departure. If you ever visit Ubud and are in need of transportation I strongly recommend that you utilize Dewa, he is much more affordable than hotel sponsored transportation and is just a joy to be around.

Fantastic guide. We had a full day tour with Dewa when we visited Kintamani, Tegalalang, Tirta Empul and Coffee Plantation. Starting from the first, he was very accommodative and connected well with us. Got to know a lot about the Balinese culture from him. Communication is very smooth, just like his driving. He even took us to a nearby waterfall although it was not part of the tour. You can't go wrong picking him. Highly recommended!

Tours with Dewa and Nyoman. Perfect day tour with Dewa to North Bali (Bratan...): Dewa speaks perfectly english, told us everything about Balinese culture and entertained us even with jokes. He took several fotos from us (very talented I have to admit). All in all a perfect day. PS: with his wise words and his attitude towards life we now reflecting ourselves. Perfect day tour to East Bali (Tanganan) and trekking tour (Batur) with Nyoman: Nyoman speaks also perfectly english. Very gentle and friendly guy. One day he wore traditional clothes and told us everything about daily balinese life especially with regard to religion and traditional ceremonies. Thank you especially for keeping cool at the airport searching our hotel. We hope that we see you guys very soon.

Best guide in Bali!. We travelled with Dewa for 2 days around Bali. It was a very nice experience! He took us to some very nice spots and really showed us the best of Bali in our limited time with him. He was very friendly, funny, helpful and always happy to take some beautiful pictures. I can only recommend! Thank you Dewa!

Dewa tours. Me and my friend recently went to Bali for the first time. We were a little nervous about getting around and did not really know where to go. Dewa picked us up at the airport and took us on a couple of tours. Dewa was really nice and gave us a lot of information about the culture and history of the locations we visited.He was very accommodating with our requests and created custom tours for us (temples, beaches, stores, food). He even drove us to areas outside of Ubud when we changed hotels. I would recommend Dewa to anyone needing driving service in Bali. If we go again we will definitely contact him again.

The only way to travel to Amed!. We hired Dewa's services for the day to take us on a one way east Bali sight seeing trip from Ubud to our accommodation in Amed. There is a lot to see on the way to Amed so I highly recommend making a day of it. Mr Dewa took us to Klang Kung justice palace, bat cave temple, white sand beach and two water gardens. Mr Dewa spoke excellent English and was very knowledgable about the history and culture or Bali. He is a very kind and patient man. He also many photos of us and let us know when he thought it would be a good photo opportunity. We can't recommend Mr Dewa and the east Bali trip enough.

Highly recommended!. Having Dewa drive you around the island is the only way to go if you are visiting Bali! He drove us all over for three days and he was very punctual, always arriving at our hotel right at 9am. He is a very safe driver, he is honest, and he is knowledgeable about the country/culture and will answer all your questions. His car was nice and clean, and the air conditioning was a life saver! An unexpected bonus to having Dewa as your driver is that he is also an excellent photographer! Thank you so much for making our visit to Bali so memorable Dewa!

Excellent guide. We had uncle dewa for a day and he drove us to places of interest and was able to explain to us in details of the temples,monkey Forest etc. He even went to climb a mangosteen tree for us to taste the fruit.. Speaks good English and is a responsible guide cum driver.

Wonderful driver. I was so lucky to have Dewa as the driver for my day tour.He was so professional,friendly,patient and gave us a lot of good informations about Bali and the service was very reasonable price.I'll definitely use his service again for my next visit Bali.

The person to look for if u need a personal guide . My friends and I visited ubud ard mid-may and we got Dewa to fetch us from the airport. We had a chat with Dewa and actually planned our next day tour during the ride from the airport to the resort!He picked us up on time and started the tour as planned. As the day progressed he realized one of us could not visit temples and he suggested other alternative places of interest on-the-go. The day tour was actually meant to be relaxing but when he realized we may be missing out on the places to visit in ubud because of our schedules he actually cramped more places for us to visit! During the tour he brought us to a nice silver and wood carving shop but that is after we have agreed to go. He did not hard sell or force us to go. We bought beautiful silver pieces and wood carving at reasonable prices and we're happy with our purchases.To be honest I think that day tour covers more than wat we would have seen on our 4 days in ubud haha. He was very knowledgeable and told us lots of stories and explained Balinese cultures, belief and their way of life. He also recommended and helped us to book a good and affordable massage place. All in all we spent a wonderful day with Dewa. Oh he was actually sick on the morning of our tour but he did not cancel our trip which we were very grateful of. Thank you Dewa

Excellent guide and great service. We have used the service of Pak Dewa two times. First time for my sister and her daughter to make a two days tour of Bali. Second time to arrange transport to north Bali.Each time, the service has been excellent and reliable. First the advice are excellent. Pak Dewa is not pushing to visit very over-rated touristic places to spend your dollars. Visits were well done and allowed a authentic discovery of Bali. Second, the service was very reliable. On time and good price.I would strongly recommend Pak Dewa for you visit and transportation needs in Bali and we will not hesitate to come back to him of course !

Wonderful driver, photographer, and tour guide. I was very happy to have Dewa Alit be my tour guide for the day. I contacted him on short notice and he was very quick to respond. He even offered suggestions and ideas for what I could do for my day tour. His English is very good and I learned so much about Bali and the culture. I was a solo traveler so it was nice that he enjoys photography and was able to take some really cool pictures for me at all the places. I decided to do the East Bali tour including Tirta Gangga, White Sand Beach, Bat Cave Temple, Taman Kertha Gosa, and Goa Gajah. He even provided a sarong for the temples that required one so that I did not have to worry about purchasing one. The cost was a little higher than what you might find on the street but it was worth knowing this is someone you can trust. It was also nice having it prearranged and simply being picked up at my hotel.

Great trip. We had certain destinations in mind and sent Dewa Alit an email and they took us on a great tour the day after. The driver was very well informed about all the places and understood everything that we asked. He also talked good english. Book the if you are in Ubud.

Wonderful guided tour with a perfect guide. What I have to say first, before I describe or explain anything else, is that this guy is absolutely recommendable.We decided quite spontaneously to make a guided tour around the Ubud area on the next day. We got in email contact via Tripadvisor with Dewa and asked if he could make us an offer for a guided tour. Within less than two hours, we had organized out of four optional tours he offers (whereas every tour sounded really interesting and worth to join), one with our specific wishes. We wanted to see temples, fruit and coffee plantains, rice fields and traditional Balinese lifestyle. Dewa's tours are about from 9 am to 6 pm and cost about 50-60 US $, which is a really attractive price for that, what he offers and what you get on whole day tour (one price for all participants including shuttling, patrol etc...) Dewa speaks fluently English, he explains nearly everything, he has answered each of our questions, he is absolutely polite and really helpful. He picked us up at our hotel exactly in time, which could be important for Germans ;-)...(what I have to mention...I am a German ;-)). We visited each point of our tour, got a lot of information and impressions of Balinese traditions and lifestyle. Furthermore, Dewa took a lot of great pictures with our camera and with our smartphones...a lot of pictures of us in motion and in beautiful arrangements. So give him your camera and let him work ;-). Between the stops Dewa gave us a lot advises what to buy for what price and how to haggle best. Our wish to make a stop for lunch and get real Balinese traditional food was perfectly fulfilled. We got food we would never have found and never ate without Dewa.I participated in a traditional water purification ceremony what I would never have done without Dewa, too.So taken all together and recapitulating the whole day, it was a perfect day for us with a lot of fun.So plan your guided tour together with Dewa, let him guide you around Ubud and enjoy your day in paradise!

The guide we had was amazing and so easy to talk to.. This was an amazing experience for my husband and I . We learnt so much about life in bali and their traditions. The walk was not too taxing, and we were able to stop any time. We met lots of lovely locals who happily invited us to either see what they were doing, or even taste their local produce! The guide was very flexible, and adapted the pace and stops to suit us.. It was the highlight of our trip. Great lunch too!

Great day trip with an excellent and patient guide. We booked a day trip in advance with Dewa and agreed the main points to visit, he was very kind and gave us many useful hints. He can speak fluent English and has a lot of experience, so he knows well what to suggest for each client. He picked us up from the hotel and was driving in a very safe way. Great, flexible driver, tour guide and a local buddy!

Dewa's tour was the highlight of our Bali trip. We pre-booked Dewa for two full day tours in Northern Bali/Ubud, and ended up using him for an additional drive from Ubud to Seminyak because we enjoyed his company so much. We sent Dewa a rough idea of the attractions/areas we wanted to see, but left most of the decision power in his hands. We were overly impressed with his suggestions and itinerary for what to see and do. He shared invaluable amounts of knowledge about the Balinese culture with us, came prepared with umbrellas and sarongs, but most of all, was friendly and kind. We will most definitely be recommending him to all friends/family who travel to Bali, and can't wait to come back to see him again. We had some bad experiences with other drivers within the Ubud area (because of bad English and a feeling they were ripping us off) so make sure to pre-book with Dewa - you will realize how valuable he is once you're there!

Day trip to the north with Putu was amazing . My mum and I booked a day trip to visit Lovina and the surrounding temples and lakes- the driver, putu pucked us up at 9am and literally dropped us bsck at 8pm. The day was amazing and Putu was fantastic. Highly highly recommend booking through these guys

Excellent guide and driver. We visited Bali in March 2016 and booked two full day tours plus airport pickup and dropoff with Dewa a few months in advance. We read the reviews and he definitely didn't disappoint. Excellent driver keeping us safe in the crazy Bali roads (incredibly unsafe place to drive). He was also very knowledgeable about the different place and very flexible. He was constantly trying to help us to make the most of our Bali experience, going above and beyond what we expected. He took us to the Sekumpul waterfalls (which are out of the way, far north) and was with us the whole way, saving us the additional guide that you may need to get to the falls.Dewa's English is very good and made our visit in Bali so much better. We definitely recommend him

Great tour with pickup in Sanur. Dewa was highly recommended by a good friend. From the first contact he was very pleasant and provided many options to help us explore Bali the way we wanted to. Dewa was unavailable the day of our tour so unfortunately we didn't get to meet him in person. However he sent a very capable replacement, Wayan. Our tour with Wayan was great!! Very informative about Balinese culture and religion. He did a great job. It was very pleasant spending the day with him while seeing much of Bali... All for a very inexpensive price; we were shocked at low price. Thanks Dewa and Wayan!!

Best Driver in Bali!. Hand's down the best driver that I've experienced in Indonesia. The moment you meet Dewa, you'll be amazed by his English language. He made the trip around Ubud comfortable with his approachable nature and his knowledge about Bali is great (ask him anything about Bali)! And not to mention, he's great with the camera angles :)

Amazing Driver!. We were lucky enough to have Dewa recommended to us by a friend and it was so lovely to be able to organise everything before we even got to Bali. We had Wayan as our driver and he was incredible. He picked us up from Seminyak and drove us to Ubud for the day, took us white water rafting, to the rice terraces, waterfalls and many iconic stops along the way. His car was lovely and clean and he was a very safe and comfortable driver. Wayan is easy to talk to and get along with and we enjoyed our two days with him!We would definitely use him again when we come to Bali and recommend him to friends :)

Thanks for an amazing day. Dewa is one of those guys you know you're going to get along with. He's friendly and engaging. From the moment he picked us up, interesting facts about Bali started to roll off his tongue. His knowledge of the Balinese culture is shared as if it was his own personal journey rather than from a guide book. I'm not going to repeat all the things other reviewers give him kudos for so I'm just going to say we really enjoyed our day with Dewa. Most obvious to me was his ultra safe driving. If you're looking for a great English-speaking guide in Bali, look no further.

Definitely the best driver in Ubud. We’ve used Dewa’s services a number of times, and have referred friends to him over the years. Everyone always has good things to say. Safe, reliable driver and excellent tour guide. I use Dewa Alit every time I am in Bali. He is a good, safe driver and very knowledgeable about the sights in Bali as well as the culture. I highly recommend him.

Wonderful tour guide. We used Dewa's service for couple of days. Exceptional service, goes that extra mile. Tell him what you wanna doo and he'll plan your whole day. Responds quickly to queries.Definitely tell him to take to unknown spots.

Fantastic driver! Best experience!. Dewa Alit was a fantastic driver and guide! I was traveling solo and as a younger female I was a little worried but I felt totally safe with him! Friend, Guide, Doorway to Balinese culture . Dewa Alit has been a guide and friend for years. Highly recommend Dewa Alit !!!!!. I have had the pleasure of having Dewa on 3 different tours. He is so knowledgeable about the the places he took our group. His passion for the places, Bali and the traditions is so contagious! It is just one of the reasons i love to have him as the tour guide. He is also always on time, driving a nice comfortable car and provides a very safe journey.

You are in good hands!. I would honestly say that Dewa Alit was not the first private tour provider that I contacted for our trip in Bali last October. Fortunately, Dewa Alit was the only one available and my friends and I were very happy that we got him. Although he was not very well-versed in English, we felt he tried his very best to communicate with us. We learned a lot not only about the usual tour stuff but about the real Bali life from politics to doing business in Bali. He was also very flexible with our tour itinerary allowing us to see what we only wanted because of the limited stay with had in Ubud. I would definitely get him every time I go Bali, for sure!

Dewa is fantastic. Dewa is an amazing driver. His professionalism, knowledge, and passion for Bali was very evident. Dewa saved our trip by making sure we were able to see the best of what Bali had to offer in our short remaining time there. Dewa offered us suggested tour options while managing to incorporate additional places that we wanted to see. As 2 young girls travelling on our own, we felt very safe and thankful to have Dewa tour us around Bali.

Dewa is the best ! . Very reliable and fun driver. He took us to all the places we wanted to see even though we changed our existing plan that day. He also took us into seminyak for my birthday and waited around for us until we had dinner. Dewa is very easy to talk to and we had a fantastic time with him.Would recommend !!!

Absolutely Amazing . I don't normally write reviews on here, just normally read them. Best driver in Bali. We were so grateful to have Dewa as our driver on 3 of the 5 days we had in Bali. We stayed in Ubud and we first organised to have a day trip to see the sights around the area. We were able to tell Dewa where we wanted to visit and even though it seemed like a lot, it all fell into place perfectly with his ordering of the activities. We visited many temples around Ubud and Dewa provided us with traditional sarongs to wear. We went to two amazing waterfalls, had lunch, and managed to do the ridge walk in Ubud. He was always happy to help.The next day in the afternoon, Dewa was free to take us to Seminyak where we had planned to go to a few beach clubs and restaurants then took us back home. On the last day, he drove us to the airport. We had the best memories on the occasions Dewa was able to take us around Bali.We had some great conversations and laughs during our car rides. Dewa was great company and is very easy to get along with. He is a safe and courteous driver and his car was always comfortable and well air-conditioned during the long drives. I can't recommend his service highly enough. We will see you next time we're in Bali, Dewa. Thank you!

Best experience with Dewa in Bali!!. I found Dewa's offer on the Internet and I decided to contact him. He replied very fast and we set the details. He picked me up from the airport, even provided an already cold bottle of water (most welcomed in the heat of Denpasar) and asked me again about the places I wanted to visit. No "donations", no "taxes of punishment", not even asked for the entrance ticket!! Besides, he's a treasure of informations and always prepared to face the unexpected - he even had umbrellas and sarung for the visits of the temples (it was raining that day), always kind and driving like a pro!! Flexible and curteous, good English, always careful with the guest and decent prices!! Dewa, I cannot thank you enough!! Next time in Bali... Dewa again!! :)

Reliable driver and guide. I booked tour and airport drop with Dewa Alit and I was very impressed by his quick reply and useful opinion. Our driver Wayan was also an amazing driver. He is very polite and knowledgeable. I Although we faced some bad weather, he was very fexilable and give us suggestions to change the itineraries. We have enjoyed a great holiday in Bali!

Best driver and guide for Bali!. We booked Dewa's services for 3 full days at the end of September 2015, it was a great experience! Very friendly and at the same time very respectful, he made our holiday very special. He also provided very useful tips for other activities on the island, both before arrival and while we were there! Thanks Dewa, hopefully we will come back some time soon, we will definitely contact you again!

Brilliant tour guide!!!!!. My wife and I were lucky enough to have Dewa take us on a half day tour around Ubud last November. Dewa provided excellent service in showing us the sights and took the time in sharing a lot about the Balinese culture. He is definitely more than a private driver, he is an exceptional tour guide. Thank you Dewa for a fabulous day and we will definitely contact you again if we return to Bali.

Reliable, attentive and experienced driver and guide for Bali. Dewa was the best choice I could possibly make for a driver and guide and I want to warmly recommend him to everyone who visits Bali.After I arrived in Ubud I realized I wanted to do a day tour and see more of the island than just the surroundings of the town. So on a rather short notice I contacted Dewa, he got back to me promptly and we agreed on a day tour that would take me to visit Bedugul with its lake-temple Danu Bratan, the hillside Batukaru temple and finally the rice paddy fields of Jatiluwih. The perfect guide!. This review is long overdue. After contacting three different drivers from the Ubud area, my husband and I decided to book Dewa to be our guide and driver for two full days during our honeymoon. We stayed in several places during our honeymoon, and out of the six drivers we used, Dewa was by far the best driver we had during our entire stay in Bali. During the first day, my husband and I had a pretty clear idea of what we wanted to do and specific temples we wanted to visit. Dewa was super prompt when he picked us up, and took us to all of the destinations we had asked. Dewa's English is excellent, and what set him so far apart from the other drivers is that he is truly knowledgeable about all of the sites we visited. There were several times when I would just randomly point to things along our visit because it looked interesting and ask, "What is that?" And Dewa always had an answer and could explain everything with impeccable detail. On our second day, my husband and I relied more on Dewa's input for what we wanted to do because we didn't have specific locations we wanted to visit. We mentioned things like, "We want to see woodcarvers." Dewa then suggested we first visit one shop where we could watch woodcarvers in action, but that we shouldn't buy anything because he would take us to a different shop with the same quality but much better prices. After visiting both shops, my husband and I were so glad that Dewa took the time to let us know about the second shop because it really was so much better of a deal without sacrificing quality. When suggesting other locations to visit, Dewa was very objective in describing the pros and cons of each location, but ultimately leaving the decision up to us. In between locations, Dewa was a pleasure to talk to, because he is such a gracious gentleman who cares deeply about his family. On both days, we offered to buy Dewa lunch, and he graciously refused. At the end of each day, we gave Dewa a huge tip, and both times he tried to protest, but we insisted that he deserved it. Overall, if you want a knowledgeable driver with fantastic English that can offer great insight into every location in Bali, book Dewa Alit and you will not be sorry!

Dewa is THE person to drive you around!!. If you are looking for a professional, affordable, safe, knowledgeable and custom driver then look no further. Dewa is THE person to drive you around Bali!! Very experienced & friendly guide!. We had 3 days together with Dewa in Bali.Already before our trip we had a very positive impression. A don't miss! if you want to see Bali through locals' eyes.... First of all, this was a honeymoon trip (actually 4-day excursion), so our expectations were really high. We first met with the Dewa Alit private driver (his name is Dewa Parba) at the airport, as we had arranged a transfer to Ubud. First impression: very friendly, warm, welcoming, eager to show us around. English: totally adequate. In brief: the services provided had a serious shortcoming: they were SO amazing and fulfilling that 4 days were just not enough to endeavour into real Bali and its numerous beauties! Of course it is the services provided by the company. But, to my opinion, our explicit experience was also due to Dewa Parba, our driver... The way he drove (fast, efficient and safe), knowing the perfect balance of making wishes come true but also taking the initiative to surprise you by making his own selections and suggestions, contributed to this perfection. Driving you with a spacious, clean car throughout Bali, being informative, polite, courteous, warm-hearted and smiling all the time really made us feel like his niece and nephew. No exaggeration! Although the trip was carefully planned by us from beforehand, he managed (together with the owner of the company) to have a surprise every day of our trip. We never thought that every day would make us say 'wooooow' for different reasons. That's the beauty of Bali! And we wish to deeply thank Dewa for helping see and live this through his eyes and heart. Practical things: he arranged the best, off the beaten track restaurants, walks within rice fields with the locals, a traditional relaxing massage, hiking to Mt. Batur with a local guide, visiting the white beach near Candidasa (known mainly amongst locals), wandering around the first traditional village of Bali, swimming in the Gitgit waterfall (during a tropical storm!), etc etc. Thank you so much, hope to see you again!! Conclusion: unconditionally, hand-at-fire recommended...

He knows his stuff around Bali. Dewa was extremely knowledgable, friendly, warm, and flexible. He tailored the tour completely to our interests and was easy to work with. We felt completely safe riding with him and felt as though he was really treating us as friends rather than paying customers. We got in depth background at all the sites we visited and he patiently explained and answered everything with a smile. Furthermore, he never rushed us in trying to meet a schedule especially for someone who loves taking photos. You must choose him as your driver and tour guide!

Disappointing!. We booked a private tour with Dewa Alit tours, but gathered it was not Dewa who took us round on the day. We were really impressed initially, as we only sent a mail requesting this private tour the day before and received a quick and helpful response to our communication. The cost also was as advertised and seemed very worthwhile. However, our experience was in no way what other reviews of Dewa Alit reflect, particularly in terms of personal and local input offered to places visited. In fairness, we enjoyed safe transportation which is important on the winding roads. We also discovered during the day that our driver had apparently just lost a family member, which was probably why he appeared rather disinterested in providing an awesome experience and spent a great deal of time at places we visited on his mobile phone. Our disappointment however was mainly in that we felt as though we might as well have just joined a large tourist bus, and that the requests we had made for places to visit were not properly fulfilled. Our strong recommendation to others is to try and organise a private trip far in advance and be extremely specific in requesting and naming the places you wish to visit. We requested "a chocolate and coffee plantation" and were not taken to the Pod factory as we expected particularly as it was right next to the Elephant park we visited, but were instead taken to a type of coffee shop, the Subak Bali Agro, which is in a main street. and the kind of place that one has to sidestep busloads of tourists. There, apart from seeing a few plants and two sad baby Luwaks in a cage, we were offered (albeit with a very pleasant "guide") tea and coffee tastings and were made to feel obliged to then purchase from their very expensive shop. Also, after our visit to the Beratan temple, we were taken to a restaurant nearby and, on querying whether there was not a better option, we were told that we were less likely to get "Bali Belly" there. However, the very the indifferent buffet food on offer was again typical of a restaurant where busloads of tourists are taken and, bearing in mind our verbal request to have something typically Balinese, was not the kind of lunch venue recommendation we expected at all. What was most disappointing was to discover, not much further on close to the Munduk waterfall where we headed, a restaurant called "the View" offered the most amazing views (and has great reviews) and would have been a vastly preferable place to stop for lunch. Frankly, this was the kind of recommendation we would have expected from a driver who knows the area and has supposedly been driving tourists for over 20 years. While our day was pleasant enough, we felt we were being taken to "canned" places rather than being offered a more intimate experience through a private tour operator.

The Best Balinese driver. Well, where to strart from...We booked our 4 honeymoon daytrips + arrivel airport transfer to Ubud with Dewa Alit. Unfortunately he was busy those days and sent us his good friend Mr. Dewa Parba :-) HE WAS GREAT!! We had 4 whole days tours and he drove us (the car was very clean and he was very careful) not only to the places i had asked for, but to other places and restaurants we didnt know! He arranged a massage and the hiking to Mt. Batur for us, we also visited many temples, the white beach near Candidasa, the first traditional village of Bali, the Gitgit waterfall, Lake Bratan, Jatiluwih & Tegallalang terraces and so many other wonderful places all over the island. Mr. Parba was so kind, patient and gendle with us. He speaks very good english and we had long talks during our trips for the Balinese life and customs. You have to ask for Mr. Parba when you visit Ubud! Thank you so much, hope to see you again!!

Professional service. We booked airport transfers and 2 excursions via internet. Dewa Alit Tours promptly answered to my emails and they were able to fit the tours based on what I wanted to see. Our driver and guide Nyoman was very professional and helpful. First day starting from Ubud we visited Gunung Kawi, Tirta Empul temple, coffee plantation, Batur Volcano, Tegallalang rice terrace. Second day Wood carving, painting shops, Bali bird park, Ulun Danu Bratan Temple, Jatiluwih rice terrace and sunset at Tanah Lot temple.

If You Have to Do One Comprehensive Tour in Bali..Go with Dewa. Initially, we booked Dewa with the premise that we would just hit up the 'must see' sites around Ubud like the Tegalalang Rice Fields, Titra Empul, and Gunung Kawi. However, we got much more than simply a driver to certain sites. We got a vibrant picture of and immersed in Balinese culture. Dewa has a good command in English not to mention a wealth of information about Balinese tradition and great patience! I must have changed our proposed itineraries 3-4 times and each time he patiently oblige to the changes. Our first stop was the Tegalalang Rice Fields, which he took us to a gorgeous walk around the rice fields. He was not shy to always grab the camera to take pictures for us and he knew where the 'go to places' were to get some great shots there. Disclaimer: the tour price pays for petrol, the tour, water, and driver. It does not pay for entrance fees and lunch. Please be advised that there is a 'city fee' when you get within the vicinity to the rice fields. Dewa is honest and looks out for you. There were multiple times on the rice fields that people would ask for donations and he will let you know when it's appropriate or not. He didn't have to but there were moments were he gave a donation on our behalf. The Tegalanglang Rice Fields were sweepingly gorgeous. On our 3 weeks in Bali, it was probably the most highest in elevation that we saw. Afterwards, we made a trip to Gunung Kawi, where we got a very extensive history lesson on each tomb and temple there. Land wise, its not too much to cover but the historical context was informative and extensive. We even ventured into the Kings special prayer room that not a lot of people would know about. There was even a touch of magic and folklore in his historical account of the temple. He let us know the first set of tombs off to the distance of the main temple were those of the King's four favorite consorts. Dewa knows his stuff. We went to the elephant temple as well but the most memorable was Titra Empul.I've read much about the temple and dreamed about participating in a blessing at the holy springs. No better way to experience a place than to do what the locals do. Dewa made it happen! Dewa explained the ritual and its cultural context and walked me through what I should do. There were torrential rains on that April afternoon we arrived. All the locals had taken shelter. When the rain let up a little, Dewa prompted we should go and offer our offerings at the holy springs. We got a little wet but it was such breathtaking experience. The fresh smell of rain was revitalizing and I had the whole holy spring to myself as I went through each fountain, meditating in the rain. There were large koi-like fish in the holy spring and it felt like I was in the scene of a Balinese folklore. Incredible! Note: if you want to participate in this, definitely bring an extra set of clothes, towels as you will be getting wet. Because it is a temple, you will need to wear a sarong into the holy spring and there are also other rules about women on their menstrual cycles not being permitted to enter the temple. I thought it was interesting and bit strange from a western perspective but when in another country, its always been my philosophy that you should respectfully observe their traditions and rules. With that said,we saw a water eel in the bubbling hot spring that fuels the holy springs. Per Dewa, this rarely happens and when the water eel appears, its a sign of immense luck. Without Dewa, we wouldn't have been able to have such an incredible day. Out of my 3 weeks in Bali, it was easily one of the best days in Bali It was also very affordable and fair. Unbelievably, his tour pricing is not per person, its for the whole tour itself. The day was all things I hoped for from the farthest corners of my imagination and truly Balinese. Thank you Dewa!

A full day of Balinese culture. I highly recommend Dewa to anyone who wants to see Bali and learn about its culture. The car was almost new and the driving was excellent. He spoke very good English and was very accommodating to our requests and changes to our proposed itinerary. We chose from a wide range of options of places to visit after first discussing them with him. Best day in Bali.thankyou Dewar

More of a private car than a tour . We started the day by being picked up from our hotel. The first destination was a local Balinese dance of the Barong. It took us approx 30 mins to get there with some quite erratic driving along the way, so much so that my wife felt car sick from the constant acceleration and braking. On the way we werent given much information regarding the dance from our guide. Instead we were handed a folder with one printed page explaining the dance. The Barong dance itself was interesting. After this we made our way to the silver Smith where a woman lead us around showing us briefly some of the techniques involved, which to be fair look very skilled and meticulous. We then proceeded to the show room with some over priced jewellery on show. A similar pattern was repeated at the wood carving centre. Again, it was good to look at these artists at work.From here we proceeded to a temple which was very beautiful. On arrival we happened to stop at his wifes shop who happens to sell sarongs needed to cover up going into the temple. What a coincidence!!! At the temple, our guide gave us a free pamphlet from the visitor section rather than go into detail about the various aspects of the temple. He did tell us about some aspects but very little, opting just to take pictures of us instead. The second half of the tour was an improvement. We went to a fruit and coffee plantation and we were given a guide. The guide they gave us was a young 23 year old chap and he was excellent, he had a good sense of humour, good english and had a lot of knowledge about the various different fruits, their uses and the coffee making process. We tasted several different types of coffee and tea and bought some in the shop towards the end of the tour. At one stage the guide climbed a tree to get is a piece of fruit. This was the type of interaction and knowledge transfer we hoped we would get on the tour as a whole. After this we went to look at the Batur volcano. We stopped at a pretty cool restaurant with a viewing gallery directly across from the volcano. We had lunch here. The food was poor, especially given how amazing Balinese food can be, but views during lunch are spectacular, explaining the completely overinflated price! Finally we headed for the Holy water springs and the padi fields which were quite picturesque again he waited in the car and just sent us off in. Overall we got to see many things- so pretty good itinerary, he Is a nice man and his car is spotless. Our main problems with the day were that despite what previous reviews say, Dewi's english is average at best. This is more of a private driver than tour guide, as I said, we saw a lot but just didn't receive much information at the locations. We found we really had to push him for information otherwise he didn't seem to volunteer it. Given that he is doing this for 22 years, his information was limited at times.

Best two days in Bali, thanks Wayan!!. My wife & I visited Ubud for a week in May and decided to book a full day private tour with Dewa Alit. Wonderful Guide!. After learning about him on Trip Advisor, my husband and I hired Dewa to be our driver for our first trip to Bali. Superb Guide in Bali!. My parents and I booked our tour with Dewa Alit Tours- Wayan for 4 days, he aint just a driver. He was the best guide ever. Great experience, highly recommended. We enjoyed so much the tour with Babuh Dewa Parba that we booked next day another one. Very nice driver, we can recommend this service provider as they will take great care and listen your wishes.

Best guide in Bali. Dewa knows so much and gratiously shares the values and beliefs of the Bali people, giving his tour a personal touch that I didn't expect. Like a friend showing you around Ubud.. We booked a 1-day tour of Ubud/Tanah Lot with Dewa Alit. A careful driver, he will make suggestions on the best dropoff/pickup arrangements. If you require a driver/guide while in Bali, Dewa Alit tours and Wayan are Highly Recommended!!!

Excellent tour guide. After booking a trip to Ubud with the intention to explore the area and its surroundings, we found Dewa through this website. If you're in the area of Ubud and want to see the beautiful and historic sights, contact Dewa and I can guarantee that you won't get disappointed.

Excellent Service!. A friend recommended Dewa to me for my stay in Bali. Yet he's occupied on the date we requested so he recommended his friend Wayan instead. We were very much satisfied with his service for the day so decided to continue hiring him for the next day. Highly recommend!

Excellent Driver and Guide. Dewa was our driver during our stay in Ubud. He is an excellent and reliable driver/guide. Best Tour Guide in Bali. We recently visited Bali and were fortunate to have Dewaas Our Tour Driver.He picked Us up at the airport and gave Us a Full, Relaxed Dayof touring which included Temples, Holy Spring, Lucak Coffee FarmBatik Factory,and Amazing Views of Terraced Rice Paddies.He chose a Wonderful Place for Us to have lunch, Great Foodwith a Beautiful View.My Husband needed to take a detour to have his eyeglasses repaired,Dewa found the shop that had been recommended to My Husband,with ease..Dewa was very knowledgable, friendly and helpful, with tips and suggestions.His English was perfect.His car is comfortable, and he is a very Safe Driver.We hired him to give Us another Memorable Full Day of touring on our departure day before heading to airport.His timing was Perfect, We arrived at the airport unhurried andrelaxed.The hotel we stayed at offered airport pick up and drop off,But it was well worth it to have Dewa.If ever I were to return to Bali, Dewa would be the First Contactfor availability.You will Not be disappointed.

Great service. Dewa was accomodating to my schedule. He was extremely knowledgable in Balinese religion and culture, I learned a lot from our tours. Excellent Guide. We hired Mr Dewa Alit for a day tour after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. We couldn't recommend him enough!

Booked for My parents visit to Bali. I contacted this tour company from US and booked my parents and their friends trip to Bali in January 2015. I highly recommend them.

Excellent Driver and Guide. I hired Mr. Dewa for several days of sightseeing and tours during my time in Ubud. He was an excellent companion, driver, and tour guide. We had many great discussions, great travels and a very enjoyable time. I would recommend Mr. Dewa to anyone who is traveling in Bali, and I am sure you will have a wonderful time traveling with him.

Excellent Service from Mr. Dewa Alit. My family (2 elderly, 3 adults and 1 child) spent our Chinese New Year in Ubud this year and I contacted Mr. Dewa Alit after reading his excellent review in trip advisor. Exceeded Our Expectations!. We hired Mr. Dewa Alit as our driver-guide in January based on the positive reviews from Trip Advisor's reviewers. A real nice guy. My wife and I booked a hotel transfer with Dewa from Seminyak to Ubud. He was a very pleasant fellow and answered all our questions that we had about Bali. He pointed out interesting things along the way but was not intrusive in any conversations my wife and I were having in the back. Dewa’s English is quite good and I had no problems communicating with him.His car, a Toyota, was clean, comfortable and well maintained and the A/C worked just fine.We then tried to book a personalized tour with him several days later but he was booked up. He asked if he could have one of his friends who also had a tour car to do the trip. We agreed and texted with that driver who arranged for us to go on the trip that we requested. That trip was not one of the normal offerings in the Bali online driver websites but the driver Dewa had recommended pulled it off wonderfully.A week or so later I called Dewa to transfer us from Lovina back to Seminyak and do a tour of places along the way. He arrived on time (as were all of the trips booked through him). He took us to see a beautiful waterfall that you hike down to. We then went to a Warung that served Bali Suckling Pig with a view of beautiful rice terraces flowing down the mountainsides. We had him stop and educated us on how to buy and eat the Durian fruit (If you are unfamiliar with this look it up online, you may not want to try it). He was glad to do it as it was his favorite fruit to eat. He even bought some and tied it on to the back of the car to take home to his family.Dewa was very good at taking photos of my wife and me at the various places we visited. We have some great photos of the Temple in Tanah Lot. Go there if you get a chance.I look forward to returning to Bali some day and would not hesitate to give Dewa a call to arrange an airport and hotel pickups-transfers, or book a tour with him. He does not have the fanciest of website which, I am sure, keeps his cost to you down.https://drivingubud.wordpress.com/2012/12/01/2/
Highly recommended. Dewa Alit, wonderful driver, really sweet, speaks English and excellent tour guide, hired him for a tour as well as for an airport drop off. Extremely satisfied!

Great Experience!. I relied upon the previous reviews here on Trip Advisor and contacted Dewa a few weeks before our visit to Bali. Couldn't recommend highly enough. Great day!. Dewa was fun all day, we paid a bit extra as we wanted him for a very long day to take us all over Bali. Wonderful Experience!. My husband and I recently went to Bali this past December for our Honeymoon. Wonderful driver. Awsome. Called Dewa with only an hours notice and he was happy to do a full day tour. Excellent Driver, Unparalleled Customer Service!. Dewa is a fantastic asset to any trip to Bali! What a perfect customized tour of Bali!. Dewa is great! He replied to my request for the next day really quickly. Great guide. We booked Dewa to drive us around to multiple attractions around Bali. He is a very personable, nice individual and a great driver. Excellent Tour Guide. I'm so happy I found Dewa on trip advisor. I have used many guides on trips all over Asia and Dewa is truly one of the best! Amazing tour guide / driver. I last minutely decided to book a car for the next day and e-mailed multiple companies and Dewa was the first one to reply. Friendly, informative and flexible dude!. My wife and I went on a exciting day tour with Dewa Alit before we flew back to Australia that night. Safe driver. Professional guide. We booked airport pickup and a one day tour with Dewa and we are very happy with our decision. He is very nice and informative. Amazing tour in Bali!. My boyfriend and I took a one-day tour with Dewa in October 2014, and I can't say enough good things about our experience. Wonderful experience. Have to agree with comments made. We also booked Dewa at short notice and were suitably impressed with his outstanding service. Safe driver and very professional tour guide for exceptional value. We were recommended Dewa by another tourist and we were able to book him at short notice. So much more than a driver - a true Bali Ambassador. I just want to thank Dewa for such a great day touring around central Bali. With him as our guide we were able to get as close as possible to the temples with minimal walking as he knows all the back ways and secrets to all the major draws. There is just too much to see in one day so we will be back and Dewa will be our guide. There is absolutely no reason to try to do this on your own or with a big tour company, support a local and get a more authentic experience

Customized and courteous. My elderly mum and I spent 3 days touring the Bali countryside with Dewa. Excellent service & really nice man. My husband and I just went on a tour with Dewa today. Dewa is an extremely knowledgeable and friendly guide, and we felt very comfortable with him. A very good experience. Would recommend him to anyone!. Very good driver and guide, showed us the beautiful parts of Bali and tried to bypass the more touristic parts. Choose him! No regrets.

Excellent Service and really nice man. my Family and I recently used Dewa Alits service for 2 full day tours, drop off and pick up from the Mara River Lodge and a day at Seminyak beach all from Ubud.The service provided by Dewa was second to none and he speaks excellent English and has a lot of knowledge of the excursions and surrounding areas. unfortunately Dewa was unavailable for a couple of our drop offs and we were picked up by another Dewa. I e-mailed him again when we arrived in Bali to confirm everything was still fine and got a very quick response with full confirmation of our itenaryif we return to Bali, Dewa will be one of the first people we get in touch with.

An excellent guide. We were so very fortunate to engage Dewa for two days of travel around Ubud and Eastern Bali, with a third day of transport from Candidasa to Nusa Dua. Making arrangements with him from afar by email before arriving was so easy and he was very helpful in designing our itineraries. Upon meeting him, we knew right away we were going to have three very pleasant, enjoyable and informative days. Prompt, knowledgeable, an engaging conversationalist, he helped us see 'the real Bali'. Highly recommended !

A professional driver and an excellent cultural resource. We were looking for a driver for a full-day tour into the countryside and wanted someone who could recommend places he thought we might like instead of the regular tour itineraries (we can find those places in a guidebook ourselves), the flexibility to adjust the itinerary to handle serendipitous events (we don't like to be chained to an itinerary), and the interest in his passengers to talk with us instead of having a private conversation on his cell phone the entire drive (we had already experienced that with another driver who wore headphones on a trip to the Jatilowih rice fields). In short, we wanted more than just a “driver” but also a cultural guide. Although drivers in Ubud are ubiquitous, we went to TripAdvisor to find a driver we thought would be appropriate. Based on the reviews, we thought Dewa would be perfect, and we were not disappointed. Dewa arrived at our homestay in the morning and we planned out an itinerary for the day. But soon into our drive into the countryside, we found a temple preparing for an upcoming cremation ceremony. Instead of driving by or simply pointing out what was happening as we continued on, Dewa asked if we wanted to stop. He then took us on a tour of the temple, describing the process of the ceremony itself and explaining the meaning behind each of the extensive offerings and other items. A great start to the day! Besides being a valuable cultural resource, Dewa is also a great conversationalist. During the drive, our children enjoyed the Balinese folk story of the garlic and the onion (a good child/ bad child fable) and continued to talk about it several days later. Dewa also shared a song he learned in school about planting according to the days of the week (in response to a question about planting according to the Balinese calendar). There was plenty of conversation for adults too on practically any arts, culture, social, economic or political topic under the sun. More than just a driver or tour guide, Dewa seemed to enjoy sharing his thoughts and insights about Bali with us. Besides Dewa’s interest in his passengers, his calm, professional demeanor really stands out. He also seems to enjoy rising to the challenge of meeting the specific requests of his passengers -- he actually listened to us! We asked to go to Tenganan because we were interested in weaving. He took us there, but he also suggested a little-known ikat workshop in a town along the way that we much preferred, with Dewa explaining each step of the ikat process as we watched. Later in the day, we asked if there was a beach nearby where our children could play in the waves. Dewa thought a minute and then brought us to a small hidden sandy cove near Padangbai which was just what we were looking for. Dewa knows the island well but seems to enjoy discovering new places as well, including a recently opened warung where we ate lunch.If you want to maximize the number of miles and sites you visit on your day trip, then there are many drivers who may be able to take you faster and further, checking more items off the list and providing you with an exhilarating driving experience. But if you are looking for a careful driver with a professional attitude, a wealth of cultural information and who is a great conversationalist, then Dewa should be at the top of your list. With Dewa, we visited all the places we had planned and more.

Incredible story teller; so knowledgeable about local traditions. I have had the pleasure of touring with Dewa three times. great guide. I was in Bali for Honeymoon, and It was a nice experience to hire Dewa for 1 day tour. safe hands. Driving in Bali is not for the faint hearted. Narrow roads, motorbikes, dogs, lack of road signs and too much traffic all add up to the chaos. Excellent guide!. Dewa Alit absolutely exceeded our expectations! We contacted him after reading such wonderful reviews on tripadvisor about him. Dewa is awesome!. Cannot recommend Dewa highly enough. He has such an incredibly detailed knowledge of his beautiful country's culture and history. Dewa really brought the Balinese story to life. Excellent Driver. I contacted Dewa on my niece's recommendation to arrange a day tour of the area around Ubud. My Ubud tour. I contact dewa a month in advance for a day tour around ubud. Was travelling alone and was a well awaited tour. Wow!. We spent two weeks in Bali this past June. Top-class experience. I was on a trip to Bali for a week with my girlfriend and we were both a little apprehensive, given that it was our first time to the place. A class act. I have travelled extensively around the world and Dewa is by far the best tour guide we have ever had. Splendid!. Alit was indeed an asset in my first trip to Bali. We have engaged his service for 3 days in Bali. He brought us to temples, spas, rice fields, volcano and to check out the beaches. Wonderful Experience!. We engaged Mr Dewa’s services for two full-day trips as well as return airport transfer after reading the multiple rave reviews on Tripadvisor. A 5* guide and driver. Dewa gave our family a wonderful experience in Ubud and the wider area of Bali. He was informative, engaging, charming and full of interesting stories. Outstanding driver-- highly recommend!. My husband, 2 children and I went to Bali several weeks ago, after first having been there 6 years ago. Much more than a driver!!. I have Invited Dewa Alit to be our driver on the past two trips to Bali. Dewa has an incredible knowledge of Balinese Culture and History. I think Dewa is more than a driver. He is a gentleman,

Average Tour Guide. I would rate Dewa as an average tour guide. He was very helpful in transporting us to different sites, and seemed like a very nice person. He also drove down some very scenic roads. But he did not give us much information on each site we visited.

Wonderful guide and a lovely man. Dewa is wonderful. Simply the best. We arranged our travel to four different hotels in ubud, pemuteran, sidemen and sanur all via internet with Dewa. Great experience, the way to get to see the real Bali. On my recent trip to Ubud in June (2014), I contacted Dewa for a sightseeing tour around Bali. Timely driver. Our group of 4 used Dewa's services to visit Ubud. He was very professional and responsive to e-mails. Amazing day with Made at Pura Lempuyang...but the car was very uncomfortable :-(. I found Ubud Friendly Driver from TA and since it has many positive reviews so I decided to go with them. Right from beginning, the emails communication with Astawa were really excellent. He always replied me promptly and he also answered my tons of questions really well. We actually booked the car for 2 days. One for halfday tour to go to Tegalalang rice terrace/Gunung Kawi Temple/Pura Tirta Empul. The price quoted was 500,000 rupiahs. But unfortunately we didn't end up using the service cos the driver had a flat tyre on that day so he was really late in picking us up. We wanted to start at 7.30am to avoid crowds and hotter temperature at the rice terrace, but by 8am, the driver still hadn't arrived. We called Astawa and he said about the flat tyre and apologized. So we waited a little bit more but the driver still hadn't arrived so in the end we decided to call Astawa back to cancel it. Thankfully our hotel could take us instead even though the price was a bit higher, we didn't mind at all cos time was running out. By the time we agreed with the hotel, the driver (Made) arrived. For a moment, we didn't know what to do and felt quite bad. Made apologized and we apologized too. But we said to him that we would still keep our booking for the next day.The next day we had a full day tour to go to Pura Lempuyang and this time Made was on time. So we're right on schedule. The price was 800,000 rupiahs. Made was a great driver and a great guide. I really enjoyed his company and he climbed together with me all the way up to 4th temple at Pura Lempuyang. He also explained all the Bali cultures very well to me. It was such a beautiful and special experience cos I got to witness the ceremonies at Pura Lempuyang. Just beautiful! I only climbed up to 4th temple. Next time, my goal was to climb all the way up to the highest one 7th temple :-)However, I have one complaint...the car was really uncomfortable. We felt it was not properly maintained. I remembered it was an Avanza car and normally Avanza is a good comfortable car cos my parents own one and we also used Avanza car when we did the tour with our hotel the day before and their car was so much better. So because of this, we didn't really have comfortable journey and it was such a long drive to Pura Lempuyang and the roads were all twisting, so we both got carsick :-( Thankfully we didn't throw up and I had to rest a bit after we arrived at Pura Lempuyang before commencing the climb. We got carsick again on the way back...but it's not as bad as before. Astawa emailed me again after that asking of how my trip was...and I told him all the good and bad things, exactly as what I wrote here and I hope he would take on board both my compliment and also my complaint. But there's no reply from him. So...Well despite of my carsickness, I really enjoyed Pura Lempuyang so much and I would want to go back to East Bali again next time to explore more. We actually planned to go to more places on 2nd day but there's just simply no time so we cancelled them. We also paid Made extra 200,000 rupiahs on 2nd day, just as a good gesture for the 1st day that got cancelled. So good friendly driver, but uncomfortable car...unfortunately

Awesome experience. My family and I spent 2 days in Ubud and we had reserved Astawa and his friend June to go about the city. Fabulous!!!. These guys are fantastic, nothing is a problem. We had the pleasure of spending the day with Kadek. Lovely guy and very knowledgeable. Tour guide as well. Picked us up from the airport.Booked two days of tours excellent driver great tour guideHighly recommended.

2nd time even better. This is my second time using Astawa. This time with family. Astawa is a great driver and has become a friend. His knowledge is fantastic. He's taken us to some great less visited spots. Love having him as our guide for our stay in Ubud.

Flexible and friendly driver. First off, I would like to say that Astawa is a VERY responsive to my inquiries and emails which made booking with him an ease when I was still in the states. These guys are definitely trustworthy.

His english is very good, he is always on time and his car is clean, comfortable, well maintained and has great air-conditioning. Book Astawa you will not regret it.
Fun day riding around Bali. I highly recommend this tour. Astawa was super informative and very friendly. He taught us a lot of the traditions in Bali. Well worth the money!

Wonderful Ubud. It was very easy communicating with Astawa through phone and he sent Made to bring us on our tour of Ubud. He was very patient and calm and the kids loved him. Not just a driver but a tour guide. I emailed Astawa a couple of weeks before our Bali trip. After a few quick emails our plan was sorted. Fun time in ubud. I was looking for a driver last minute since my hotel ended up being further to ubud central than I thought. I was able to contact a driver through whatsapp easily. Can accomodate what you need. If you need to get somewhere non tourist place, he can get you there. Nice people. And really good driver.

Highly Recommended!. Not only is Astawa a UFD (Ubud friendly driver), he is also an accommodating, helpful and knowledgeable person!
His service are highly recommended!

Short and sweet, comfortable and fun. 3 weeks before my Bali trip, I've contacted Astawa via email and his prompt replies always give me the peace of mind. Great Taxi Driver Ubud. Last month I spent four days in Ubud, my first visit. As the friends I was travelling with had been to Ubud before, I decided to do some exploring on my own. Great!!!. Excellent driver, so friendly, nice and professional. We had a great day and the kids loved him. No doubt, just call him for your time in Ubud.Anne Olivier Roman and Mahayt from Paris.

What a nice guy. Booked for one day, we found him so good we booked a second day, visited monkey forest, water temple, a traditional Bali house, water falls, rice field and many more

Not just an excellent driver, but also a really good guide!. I had 2 nights in Ubud with my girlfriend and we decided to hire a taxi for a day to look around. Safe and friendly driver but hardly a tour. I needed a ride from Nusa Dua to Ubud, and decided to find a tour guide so I could make the most of the few hour drive. Komang was assigned to me as my driver for the excursion. He arrived on time, the car was clean, and as a single female traveler I felt completely safe with him the whole time. He was friendly and polite, and I appreciated his calm and quiet demeanor. Since arriving in Ubud was my primary objective for hiring the company, they earn 3 stars. However if I was reviewing this as a tour company it would have been one star.The "tour" is a complete joke. As a well-traveled individual hoping to get an authentic experience of what more rural parts of Bali had to offer, I was incredibly disappointed. Instead of being brought to fun and unique sites for authentic Bali experiences, I was ushered from tourist trap to tourist trap, and accosted by high pressure sales people pushing coffee, jewelry, and wood carvings for appalling prices. They will tell you are being taken to wood carvers for "demonstrations" of how things are made in Bali. This is a lie and you are being swindled. It was only after I put my foot down and demanded a change in agenda that things got better. We stopped at a water fall and rice terrace, but ultimately the highlight was having a quick lunch at a small cafe and hearing about my driver's village. I was really sad when realizing how much time was wasted at the tourist traps and wished I had demanded a change earlier instead of hoping things would improve. If you want to earn kickbacks fine, but at least take me to an authentic or small scale operation where I can benefit the local economy as opposed to what were obviously tourist abusing conglomerates taking advantage of elderly western travelers that are inexperienced abroad. In addition, since my return I have been harassed via Facebook by the company owner to write a review. While I understand reviews are critical to the success of small businesses, I do not appreciate pushy and disrespectful communication techniques to achieve what is ultimately a one sided objective. Would I hire them again? Maybe. If I need a ride to the airport.

After we were taken to a coffee plantation which we loved and were able to see and buy lots of Bali's agricultural products. Again, Astawa proved himself to be a great guide, patient and informative. Next we headed for lunch overlooking Mount Batur, something we almost missed as we were still full from breakfast. Whatever you do, don't miss a lovely reasonably priced all you can eat buffet sat under a blanket outside overlooking one of the best views you will have ever seen. A really enjoyable trip. We had Nyoman take us on an afternoon/evening sunset tour. We told Nyoman what things we liked to do and off we went. This pretty much became a custom made tour. Nyoman made some good suggestions. Firstly we stopped at the butterfly sanctuary which was really nice and held a large collection of colourful butterflies. Then off to the nearby waterfall, sorry can't remember the name but it's close to the butterfly sanctuary. Wow, the waterfall was running well and the opportunity to swim was available, so take your bathers. There were warungs and souvenir stalls at the waterfall if you get hungry or want to shop. Next stop was for Lewak coffee and herbal tea tastings at Taman Ayu where they make the products.This was set in a jungle setting overlooking an old temple. Relaxing location where we sampled the coffee and teas which were really good. Next stop Tanah Lot for the sunset. Hundreds and hundreds of tourists rolling up on big tourist buses. This took the ambiance away to say the least but it was good to see the temple.Then we went to Melasti restaurant for our seafood dinner. This restaurant overlooks the ocean and temple and is outdoors. This was a mistake as everything we ate was bad. Aside from this we had a really enjoyable day with Nyoman. Nyoman was such a pleasant, kind and courteous man with a good sense of humour. We got to know him over the afternoon. We learned about his family and his life which was good to hear about. Nothing was too much trouble for him. If you pick a tour to Tanah Lot best not to eat there or Google restaurant reviews before selecting a restaurant. Thank you Nyoman for an enjoyable tour, we enjoyed your company very much :-)

Customised Kintamani & Temples Tour. We booked one day customised north island trip with Wayan from Ubud. It was a great day out with Wayan. He catered to all our special needs and requests. We will definitely recommend his services.

wonderful experience. My mom and I enjoyed 2 stellar days with Wayan Suka last week. Suka speaks fluent English. He has an immaculately clean and comfortable car, and drives carefully. Fabulous tour guides - friendly, knowledgeable and fun. Great family run service. I used Amansuka tours on 3 separate occasions while holidaying in Bali. In addition to this, I did not have to wait in the lobby of my hotel for them- like when they say they will be there at a certain time, they will be there!Wayan my driver/guide was a gracious and funny host where we joked around and laughed during my tour. However, it was disappointing that Wayan could not drop me off to the airport as i wanted to properly thank him for an amazing time i had with him.What i truly liked about this tour company is that its a small family run business, where the money goes back to the driver and their village. Their prices were very competitive with other tour comanies in Bali and would happily recommend them to TA readers. I would most certainly use them again without a doubt!

Professional and fun day with Wayan.
